sen.e: Koen SHIGEMORI (July 27, 1926 - October 13, 1992) was a photography critic.

sen.j: 同志社大学文学部卒業後、1949年「いけばな芸術」の編集長となり、勅使河原宏らとともに、流派を超えた新しいいけばなの方向を模索し始めた。
sen.e: After graduating from Doshisha University's Faculty of Letters, he became the chief editor of 'Ikebana geijutsu' (art of flower arrangement) in 1949 and, along with Hiroshi TESHIGAWARA and so on, started to seek a new direction in ikebana (flower arrangement) on a cross-school basis.

sen.e: On the other hand, he took part in 'Yoru no Kai' (the Night Society) organized by Taro OKAMOTO, Kiyoteru HANADA and so on, and 'Kiroku Geijutsu no Kai ' (Organization of the Documentary Arts) by Kobo ABE and so on; and started his activities looking at all kinds of arts as a whole.

sen.e: Since about 1955 he began his career as a photography critic mainly with camera magazines.

sen.j: 当時隆盛をきわめていた「リアリズム写真運動」を批判的に継承しつつ、東松照明や奈良原一高らによる新しい写真表現の登場を支持した。
sen.e: He critically succeeded to 'Realistic Photo Movement' which flourished in those days, but at the same time, welcomed the appearance of new types of photographic expression by Shomei TOMATSU, Ikko NARAHARA and so on.

sen.j: さらに現代写真の始まりを告げるウィリアム・クライン、ロバート・フランクらの仕事をいち早く紹介、評論するなど、日本の現代写真の動向に大きな影響を与えた。
sen.e: He also quickly introduced and commented on the works by William KLEIN, Robert FRANK and so on, which indicated the beginning of contemporary photography, and had a great influence on the trend of Japanese contemporary photography.

sen.j: 1958年「東京フォトスクール」を創立、1960年東京綜合写真専門学校と名称を変えて発展させ、自らの写真美学や批評精神を展開しつつ、写真家の育成に情熱を注いだ。
sen.e: Having established 'Tokyo Photo School' in 1958 and renamed it Tokyo College of Photography in 1960 for further development, he devoted himself to training photographers while he developed his own photographic aesthetics and critical spirit.

sen.j: 批評家であると同時に教育者である重森弘淹の基本的な思想は、『表現とは、作者の批評行為であり、それなくして表現は存在しない』というものでした。
sen.e: Koen SHIGEMORI's fundamental idea both as a critic and an educator was: "An expression is a creator's critical act so that there is no expression without it."

sen.j: この思想が東京綜合写真専門学校の理念として引き継がれ、多くの先鋭的で個性的な写真家を輩出し続けている。
sen.e: The idea has been carried on as the principle of Tokyo College of Photography, which continues to produce many radical and individual photographers.

sen.j: 日本写真批評家協会会員、東京綜合写真専門学校校長、多摩美術大学客員教授、武蔵野美術大学客員教授、日本映像学会常任理事を経て、1992年没。
sen.e: He was consecutively a member of Japan Photo Critics Association, the principal of Tokyo College of Photography, a guest professor at Tama Art University, a guest professor at Musashino Art University and an executive director of Japan Society of Image Arts and Sciences, and died in 1992.

He served as a member of Japan Photo Critics Association, the principal of Tokyo College of Photography, a guest professor at Tama Art University, a guest professor at Musashino Art University and an executive director of Japan Society of Image Arts and Sciences, and died in 1992.
